data.title: Oklahoma City Thunder news and rumors (Page 8)
data.meta_description: Latest news and rumors about Oklahoma City Thunder: Recent injuries, traded or signed players and coaches, team statements (page 8).
data.text:
Stats

Westbrook makes 13th triple-double, ties Grant Hill, Jason Kidd

Russell Westbrook had 20 points, 15 rebounds and 10 assists for his 13th triple-double tying Grant Hill and Jason Kidd for the most in a season over 25 years.

Coaches

Monty Williams not returning to Thunder this season after wife's death

Oklahoma City Thunder announced that assistant coach Monty Williams will not return to the team this season after the passing of his wife Ingrid last month.

NBA market

Thunder signs veteran center Nazr Mohammed

The Oklahoma City Thunder has signed free agent center Nazr Mohammed to a contract. Mohammed previously spent two seasons with the Thunder (2010-12).

Videos

Curry sinks game-winning 32-footer, sets record as Warriors beat Thunder

Stephen Curry sinks a 3-pointer, his 12th, to beat Thunder, tying the NBA single-game record for 3-pointers. He also broke NBA record for 3s in a season.

NBA market

Thunder acquires Randy Foye in exchange for Augustin, Novak

The Oklahoma City Thunder acquired guard Randy Foye from the Nuggets along with a trade exception in exchange for guard D.J. Augustin and forward Steve Novak.

NBA awards

Westbrook, Durant join Wall as Players of the Month

John Wall and Kevin Durant and Russell Westbrook were named the Eastern and Western Conference Players of the Month, respectively, for games played in December.

NBA awards

Marcin Gortat, Russell Westbrook named Players of the Week

Marcin Gortat and Russell Westbrook were named NBA Eastern and Western Conference Players of the Week, respectively, for games played Dec. 21 through Dec. 27.

Videos

Bulls' Jimmy Butler airmails buzzer-beater over Kevin Durant

Jimmy Butler beat the first-quarter buzzer with a sky-high three-pointer over Kevin Durant, which put the Chicago Bulls up six over the Thunder.

NBA games

Thunder crush Lakers for sixth straight meeting

Russell Westbrook had 23 points, 8 assists and 8 rebounds, and the Thunder steamrolled the Los Angeles Lakers for the second time in five days, 120-85.
